channel.title: Ismael Martinez
channel.description: Software Engineer & Open Source Enthusiast — articles on software development, architecture, and technology.

item.title: The AI Automation Trap
item.description: Why building is easy and deciding is hard. AI eliminated creation costs but maintenance burdens remain — teams must practice deliberate simplicity.

item.title: Making Data Visualisations Audible
item.description: A 10-year-old hackathon idea finally comes to life. Introducing sound3fy, an open-source library that adds sonification to D3.js charts for blind and low-vision users.

item.title: System Thinking, Governance, and GreenOps in the Age of AI
item.description: Reflections from APIdays London on systems thinking, governance as an enabler, managing complexity, and sustainability in AI systems.

item.title: The Death(ish) of Logs
item.description: A journey through the decades exploring how logs evolved from printed records to structured data streams and their role in OpenTelemetry and modern observability.

item.title: Observability with OpenTelemetry
item.description: Understanding the difference between monitoring and observability, and how OpenTelemetry standardises telemetry collection with traces, metrics, logs, and more.

item.title: Choreography and Orchestration
item.description: Comparing decentralised choreography with centralised orchestration in distributed systems, their trade-offs, and when to use each approach.

item.title: Event Driven Architectures
item.description: A comprehensive exploration of Event-Driven Architectures: events, mediating systems, event types, and the challenges of building distributed systems.

item.title: Automating Kibana Visualisations Generation
item.description: How I built logger-to-kibana, an open-source tool that parses source code and automatically generates Kibana visualizations from logging statements.

item.title: Setting Up My First OpenSource Python Project
item.description: A series documenting the setup process for launching my first PyPI project, logger-to-kibana, and lessons learned along the way.

item.title: Using Retroshare to Create a Secure Communications Channel
item.description: A practical guide to establishing secure communications using Retroshare, a friend-to-friend network employing GPG, P2P, and Tor/I2P technologies.
